QEMUCONF(1) General Commands Manual QEMUCONF(1)

NAME

qemuconf — simple qemu launcher with configuration files support

SYNOPSIS

qemuconf [-nv] [-q exec] ⟨config⟩ [-- qemu_options ...]

DESCRIPTION

qemuconf executes qemu(1) with arguments compiled from a ⟨config⟩ configuration file.

The options are as follows:

-n
Dry-run. Print the produced argument list to stdout, instead of executing. Useful for diagnostic purposes.
-q exec
Set the default qemu binary. This option may be overwritten by the ⟨qemubin⟩ option in the configuration file.
-v
Print version and exit.

EXAMPLES

Lets say we have the following configuration file:

#
# /etc/qemuconf.d/main.conf: configuration file for qemuconf(1)
#

qemubin /usr/bin/qemu-system-x86_64
cwd     /var/qemu/main
smp     2
m       1024
enable-kvm
drive:
  if      virtio
  file    hda.img
net nic:
  vlan    0
  model   virtio
  macaddr 82:82:9D:AF:F0:1C
net user:
  vlan    0
vnc 127.0.0.1:1

# End of file.

This configuration file will be translated by qemuconf into the following command:

/usr/bin/qemu-system-x86_64 -smp 2 -m 1024 -enable-kvm \
  -drive if=virtio,file=hda.img \
  -net nic,vlan=0,model=virtio,macaddr=82:82:9D:AF:F0:1C \
  -net user,vlan=0 \
  -vnc 127.0.0.1:1

The ⟨cwd⟩ option instructs qemuconf to chdir(2) into /var/qemu/main before executing a qemu(1) instance.

SEE ALSO

qemu(1), qemuconf-import(1)
